definition: one head/a head full of sth/one end (of a stick)/one side/headlong/directly/rapidly/simultaneously
one/1/single/a (article)/as soon as/entire/whole/all/throughout/"one" radical in Chinese characters (Kangxi radical 1)/also pr. [yao1] for greater clarity when spelling out numbers digit by digit
head/hair style/the top/end/beginning or end/a stub/remnant/chief/boss/side/aspect/first/leading/classifier for pigs or livestock/CL:個|个[ge4]
to plunge into/to run headlong into

sentences.english: The plow was pulled by a yoke of oxen.
sentences.chinese: 一对公牛同轭拉着一头犁。

sentences.english: Like the shark, it contains a shoe.
sentences.chinese: 如同一头大鲨，吞下一只鞋。

sentences.english: One end of a tube is gently inserted into the rectum.
sentences.chinese: 管的一头轻轻伸入直肠。

sentences.english: He fell headlong and landed on his face.
sentences.chinese: 他脸朝下一头栽到地上。

sentences.english: At most you are only a foolish elephant fooled by some people, HAWHAW.
sentences.chinese: 呵呵，你顶多是一头被别人忽悠的笨象。

sentences.english: I am as awkward as a cow on skates.
sentences.chinese: 我笨得像一头穿着溜冰鞋的牛。

sentences.english: Do you know that scientists a sheep into an .
sentences.chinese: 你知道吗，科学家复制了一头一模一样的克隆羊。

sentences.english: Daisy turned around and found that she was being watched by an elephant.
sentences.chinese: 戴茜转过身去，看到一头大象正在望着她。

sentences.english: It was probably the commissary of police who was making the legal summons at the other end of the street.
sentences.chinese: 也许是那警官在街的另一头，做他的例行劝降工作。

sentences.english: If I had that much money, I'd buy another mule.
sentences.chinese: 要是我有那么多钱，我早就另买一头骡子了。

sentences.english: With a good head of hair you don't need a hat.
sentences.chinese: 你有一头浓发，不必戴帽子了。

sentences.english: Vernon charges in, stands looking blinded, like an enraged bull.
sentences.chinese: 弗农冲进来站住，两眼发直，像一头激怒了的公牛。

sentences.english: You can imagine using this to butcher an elephant, to cut the hide and remove the meat.
sentences.chinese: 你可以想象一下用它来屠宰一头大象，扒皮卸肉。

sentences.english: Rolling without any knowledge of where he went, Kwuteggrappled another wolf.
sentences.chinese: 看不清自己滚到了哪里，库泰格又抱住了另一头狼。

sentences.english: Once Hancock was summoned to the aid of a whale that had washed up on the beach.
sentences.chinese: 有一回，汉考克被人召唤去解救一头搁浅的鲸鱼。

sentences.english: We looked to our left and this thing started surfing towards us and we just headed straight to the beach.
sentences.chinese: 我们向左这使得我们被浪冲起来然后一头扎向海滩。

definition: both ends/both parties to a deal
level with one's shoulders/(of two people) both the same height
head/hair style/the top/end/beginning or end/a stub/remnant/chief/boss/side/aspect/first/leading/classifier for pigs or livestock/CL:個|个[ge4]
to prick/to run or stick (a needle etc) into/jug (a classifier for liquids such as beer)
to tie/to bind/classifier for flowers, banknotes etc: bundle/Taiwan pr. [zha2]
whole body/from head to toe/single person/a suit of clothes
Mawei district of Fuzhou city 福州市[Fu2 zhou1 shi4], Fujian
ponytail (hairstyle)/horse's tail/slender fibers like horse's tail (applies to various plants)
